name: Alakazam

abilities.name: Damage Swap
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another as long as you don't Knock Out that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5000.

name: Blastoise

abilities.name: Rain Dance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach 1 Water Energy card to 1 of your Water Pokémon. (This doesn't use up your 1 Energy card attachment for the turn.) This power can't be used if Blastoise is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

flavorText: A brutal Pokémon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high-speed tackles.

name: Chansey

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Chansey during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Chansey does 80 damage to itself.

flavorText: A rare and elusive Pokémon that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to catch it.

name: Charizard

abilities.name: Energy Burn
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard in order to use this attack.

flavorText: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to unintentionally cause forest fires.

name: Clefairy

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Clefairy's type is still Colorless.)

flavorText: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.

name: Gyarados

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

name: Hitmonchan
flavorText: While seeming to do nothing, it fires punches in lightning-fast volleys that are impossible to see.

name: Machamp

abilities.name: Strikes Back
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's attack damages Machamp (even if Machamp is Knocked Out), this power does 10 damage to the attacking Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) This power can't be used if Machamp is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed when your opponent attacks.

flavorText: Using its amazing muscles, it throws powerful punches that can knock its victim clear over the horizon.

name: Magneton

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 80 damage to itself.

flavorText: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. It frequently appears when sunspots flare up.

name: Mewtwo

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Barrier
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Mewtwo in order to prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mewtwo during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: A scientist created this Pokémon after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

name: Nidoking

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage and Nidoking does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

flavorText: Uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break its prey's bones.

name: Ninetales

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Ninetales in order to use this attack.

flavorText: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

name: Poliwrath

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwrath but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

flavorText: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.

name: Raichu

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Raichu.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Raichu does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

name: Venusaur

abilities.name: Energy Trans
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to a different one. This power can't be used if Venusaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

flavorText: This plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Zapdos in order to use this attack.

flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon said to appear from clouds while wielding enormous lightning bolts.

name: Beedrill

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Flies at high speed and attacks using the large, venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

flavorText: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.

name: Dugtrio

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunderpunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage plus Electabuzz does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: Normally found near power plants, it can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

name: Electrode

abilities.name: Buzzap
abilities.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out Electrode and attach it to 1 of your other Pokémon. If you do, choose a type of Energy. Electrode is now an Energy card (instead of a Pokémon) that provides 2 energy of that type. You can't use this power if Electrode is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Electric Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Electrode does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

name: Pidgeotto

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Pidgeotto was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Pidgeotto to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Very protective of its sprawling territory, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Arcanine in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Arcanine does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: A Pokémon that has been long admired for its beauty. It runs gracefully, as if on wings.

name: Charmeleon

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmeleon in order to use this attack.

flavorText: When it swings its burning tail, it raises the temperature to unbearably high levels.

name: Dewgong

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

name: Dratini
flavorText: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.

name: Farfetch'd

attacks.name: Leek Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. Either way, you can't use this attack again as long as Farfetch'd stays in play (even putting Farfetch'd on the Bench won't let you use it again).

flavorText: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. This sprig is used much like a metal sword.

name: Growlithe
flavorText: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

name: Haunter

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: You can't use this attack unless the Defending Pokémon is Asleep.

flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

name: Ivysaur

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: When the bulb on its back grows large, the Pokémon seems to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

name: Jynx

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Merely by meditating, the Pokémon launches a powerful psychic energy attack.

name: Kadabra

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Kadabra in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Kadabra.

flavorText: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches even to those just nearby.

name: Kakuna

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Kakuna during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

name: Machoke

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 50 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke.

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: Machoke does 20 damage to itself.

flavorText: Its muscular body is so powerful that it must wear a power-save belt to help regulate its motions.

name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.

flavorText: In the distant past, it was stronger than its horribly weak descendants that exist today.

name: Magmar

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Magmar in order to use this attack.

flavorText: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

name: Nidorino

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.

name: Porygon

attacks.name: Conversion 1
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has a Weakness, you may change it to a type of your choice other than Colorless.

attacks.name: Conversion 2
attacks.text: Change Porygon's Resistance to a type of your choice other than Colorless.

flavorText: A Pokémon that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.

name: Raticate

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: Does damage to the Defending Pokémon equal to half the Defending Pokémon's remaining HP (rounded up to the nearest 10).

flavorText: It uses its whiskers to maintain its balance. It seems to slow down if they are cut off.

name: Seel
flavorText: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. This horn is used for bashing through thick ice.

name: Wartortle

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Wartortle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: Often hides in water to stalk unweary prey. When swimming quickly, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

name: Abra

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and teleport to safety.

name: Bulbasaur

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Bulbasaur.

flavorText: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. Thus, a plant sprouted and now grows with this Pokémon.

name: Caterpie

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

name: Charmander

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmander in order to use this attack.

flavorText: Obviously prefers hot places. If it gets caught in the rain, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

name: Diglett
flavorText: Lives about three feet underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.

name: Doduo

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

name: Drowzee

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.

name: Gastly

attacks.name: Sleeping Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Destiny Bond
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Gastly in order to use this attack. If a Pokémon Knocks Out Gastly during your opponent's next turn, Knock Out that Pokémon.

flavorText: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

name: Koffing

attacks.name: Foul Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned; if tails, it is now Confused.

flavorText: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.

name: Machop
flavorText: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.

name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magnemite does 40 damage to itself.

flavorText: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses attacks like Thunder Wave.

name: Metapod

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Metapod during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It is vulnerable to attack because its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

name: Nidoran ♂

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger, more powerful of its horns secretes venom.

name: Onix

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Onix (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, though colored black.

name: Pidgey

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Pikachu does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity can cause lightning storms.

name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwag but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd don't count.

flavorText: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming over trying to stand.

name: Ponyta
flavorText: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything flat in moments.

name: Rattata
flavorText: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

name: Sandshrew

attacks.name: Sand-attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

flavorText: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.

name: Squirtle

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Squirtle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. It powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

name: Starmie

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Water Energy card attached to Starmie in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Starmie.

attacks.name: Star Freeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value this core as a gem.

name: Staryu
flavorText: An enigmatic Pokémon that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.

name: Tangela

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Its whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. These vines shake as it walks.

name: Voltorb
flavorText: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Monster Ball, it has zapped many people.

name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. Its tail splits from the tip as it grows older.

name: Weedle

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp, venomous stinger on its head.

name: Clefairy Doll
rules: Play Clefairy Doll as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Clefairy Doll counts a a Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Clefairy Doll has no attacks, can't retreat, and can't be Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. If Clefairy Doll is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Clefairy Doll.

name: Computer Search
rules: Discard 2 of the other cards from your hand in order to search your deck for any card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Devolution Spray
rules: Choose 1 of your own Pokémon in play and a Stage of Evolution. Discard all Evolution cards of that Stage or higher attached to that Pokémon. That Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, Poisoned, or anything else that might be the result of an attack (just as if you had evolved it).

name: Impostor Professor Oak
rules: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, then draws 7 cards.

name: Item Finder
rules: Discard 2 of the other cards from your hand in order to put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Lass
rules: You and your opponent show each other your hands, then shuffle all the Trainer cards from your hands into your decks.

name: Pokémon Breeder
rules: Put a Stage 2 Evolution card from your hand on the matching Basic Pokémon. You can only play this card when you would be allowed to evolve that Pokémon anyway.

name: Pokémon Trader
rules: Trade 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards in your hand for 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards from your deck. Show both cards to your opponent. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Scoop Up
rules: Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play and return its Basic Pokémon card to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that card.)

name: Super Energy Removal
rules: Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon in order to choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and up to 2 Energy cards attached to it. Discard those Energy cards.

name: Defender
rules: Attach Defender to 1 of your Pokémon. At the end of your opponent's next turn, discard Defender. Damage done to that Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Trade 1 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile.

name: Full Heal
rules: Your Active Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.

name: Maintenance
rules: Shuffle 2 of the other cards from your hand into your deck in order to draw a card.

name: PlusPower
rules: Attach PlusPower to your Active Pokémon. At the end of your turn, discard PlusPower. If this Pokémon's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Pokémon Center
rules: Remove all damage counters from all of your own Pokémon with damage counters on them, then discard all Energy cards attached to those Pokémon.

name: Pokémon Flute
rules: Choose 1 Basic Pokémon card from your opponent's discard pile and put it onto his or her Bench. (You can't play Pokémon Flute if your opponent's Bench is full.)

name: Pokédex
rules: Look at up to 5 cards from the top of your deck and rearrange them as you like.

name: Professor Oak
rules: Discard your hand, then draw 7 cards.

name: Revive
rules: Put 1 Basic Pokémon card from your discard pile onto your Bench. Put damage counters on that Pokémon equal to half its HP (rounded down to the nearest 10). (You can't play Revive if your Bench is full.)

name: Super Potion
rules: Discard 1 Energy card attached to your own Pokémon in order to remove up to 4 damage counters from that Pokémon.

name: Bill
rules: Draw 2 cards.

name: Energy Removal
rules: Choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and discard it.

name: Gust of Wind
rules: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

name: Potion
rules: Remove up to 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Switch
rules: Switch 1 of your own Benched Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

name: Double Colorless Energy
rules:
Provides ColorlessColorless energy.
Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.

name: Clefable

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Clefable's type is still Colorless.)

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: All damage done by attacks to Clefable during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: A timid Fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.

name: Electrode

attacks.name: Chain Lightning
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon isn't Colorless, this attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon of the same type as the Defending Pokémon (including your own).

flavorText: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

name: Flareon

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Flareon in order to use this attack.

flavorText: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.

name: Jolteon

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It accumulates negative ions from the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.

name: Kangaskhan

attacks.name: Fetch
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is three years old.

name: Mr. Mime

abilities.name: Invisible Wall
abilities.text: Whenever an attack (including your own) does 30 or more damage to Mr. Mime (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power can't be used if Mr. Mime is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: If interrupted while miming, it will slap around the enemy with its broad hands.

name: Nidoqueen

attacks.name: Boyfriends
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Nidoking you have in play.

flavorText: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

name: Pidgeot

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, return the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand.

flavorText: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

name: Pinsir

attacks.name: Irongrip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing its victim around and toss it hard.

name: Scyther

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, Scyther's Slash attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

flavorText: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one of it.

name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Thick Skinned
abilities.text: Snorlax can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. This power can't be used if Snorlax is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

name: Vaporeon

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Vaporeon but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

flavorText: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin that is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

name: Venomoth

abilities.name: Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may change the type of Venomoth to the type of any other Pokémon in play other than Colorless. This power can't be used if Venomoth is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Venom Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

flavorText: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

name: Victreebel

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your next turn.

flavorText: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Vileplume is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. Vileplume is now Confused (after doing damage).

flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

name: Wigglytuff

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.

name: Clefable

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Clefable's type is still Colorless.)

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: All damage done by attacks to Clefable during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: A timid Fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.

name: Electrode

attacks.name: Chain Lightning
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon isn't Colorless, this attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon of the same type as the Defending Pokémon (including your own).

flavorText: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

name: Flareon

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Flareon in order to use this attack.

flavorText: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.

name: Jolteon

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It accumulates negative ions from the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.

name: Kangaskhan

attacks.name: Fetch
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is three years old.

name: Mr. Mime

abilities.name: Invisible Wall
abilities.text: Whenever an attack (including your own) does 30 or more damage to Mr. Mime (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power can't be used if Mr. Mime is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: If interrupted while miming, it will slap around the enemy with its broad hands.

name: Nidoqueen

attacks.name: Boyfriends
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Nidoking you have in play.

flavorText: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

name: Pidgeot

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, return the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand.

flavorText: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

name: Pinsir

attacks.name: Irongrip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing its victim around and toss it hard.

name: Scyther

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, Scyther's Slash attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

flavorText: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one of it.

name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Thick Skinned
abilities.text: Snorlax can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. This power can't be used if Snorlax is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

name: Vaporeon

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Vaporeon but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

flavorText: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin that is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

name: Venomoth

abilities.name: Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may change the type of Venomoth to the type of any other Pokémon in play other than Colorless. This power can't be used if Venomoth is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Venom Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

flavorText: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

name: Victreebel

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your next turn.

flavorText: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Vileplume is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. Vileplume is now Confused (after doing damage).

flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

name: Wigglytuff

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.

name: Butterfree

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10).

flavorText: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

name: Dodrio

abilities.name: Retreat Aid
abilities.text: As long as Dodrio is Benched, pay Colorless less to retreat your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Dodrio.

flavorText: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

name: Exeggutor

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch Exeggutor with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.

name: Fearow

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Fearow.

flavorText: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

name: Gloom

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Foul Odor
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Gloom are now Confused (after doing damage).

flavorText: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool; it is a nectar that is used to attract prey.

name: Lickitung

attacks.name: Tongue Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a stinging sensation when it licks enemies.

name: Marowak

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fighting Basic Pokémon card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

flavorText: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to K.O. targets.

name: Nidorina

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

name: Parasect

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.

name: Persian

attacks.name: Pounce
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Persian during your next turn, any damage done by the attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

flavorText: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

name: Primeape

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Primeape is now Confused (after doing damage).

flavorText: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until its quarry is caught.

name: Rapidash

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Rapidash.

flavorText: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

name: Rhydon

attacks.name: Ram
attacks.text: Rhydon does 20 damage to itself. If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon. Switch the Pokémon even if Rhydon is knocked out.)

flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3600 degrees.

name: Seaking
flavorText: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.

name: Tauros

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Rampage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Tauros. Flip a coin. If tails, Tauros is now Confused (after doing damage).

flavorText: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

name: Weepinbell

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: It spits out poisonpowder to immobilize the enemy, and then finishes the enemy with a spray of acid.

name: Bellsprout

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Bellsprout and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

flavorText: A carniverous Pokémon that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.

name: Cubone

attacks.name: Snivel
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Cubone during your opponent's next turn, any damage done by the attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Cubone.

flavorText: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this Pokémon's real face.

name: Eevee

attacks.name: Tail Wag
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Eevee during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

flavorText: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from elemental stones.

name: Exeggcute

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Exeggcute.

flavorText: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.

name: Goldeen
flavorText: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname "Water Queen."

name: Jigglypuff

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

name: Mankey

abilities.name: Peek
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at one of the following: the top card of either player's deck, a random card from your opponent's hand, or one of either player's Prizes. This power can't be used if Mankey is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

flavorText: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment, then thrashing away the next.

name: Meowth

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

flavorText: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

name: Nidoran ♀

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Nidoran ♂ or Nidoran ♀ and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

flavorText: Although small, its venomous barbs make this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

name: Oddish

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sprout
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Oddish and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

flavorText: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.

name: Paras

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing nutrients from the bug host.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity can build and cause lightning storms.

name: Rhyhorn

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Rhyhorn during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

flavorText: Its massive bones are 1,000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.

name: Spearow

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Spearow was attacked last turn, do the final result of that attack on Spearow to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speeds to stay airborne.

name: Venonat

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Venonat equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.

name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, you may search your deck for any Basic Pokémon or Evolution card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Aerodactyl

abilities.name: Prehistoric Power
abilities.text: No more Evolution cards can be played. This power stops working while Aerodactyl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

flavorText: A ferocious prehistoric Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

name: Articuno

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

name: Ditto

abilities.name: Transform
abilities.text: If Ditto is your Active Pokémon, treat it as if it were the same card as the Defending Pokémon, including type, Hit Points, Weakness, and so on, except Ditto can't evolve, always has this Pokémon Power, and you may treat any Energy attached to Ditto as Energy of any type. Ditto isn't a copy of any other Pokémon while Ditto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

flavorText: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

name: Dragonite

abilities.name: Step In
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dragonite is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: An extremely rarely seen marine Pokémon. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.

name: Gengar

abilities.name: Curse
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokémon). This power can't be used if Gengar is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Under a full moon, this Pokémon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

name: Haunter

abilities.name: Transparency
abilities.text: Whenever an attack does anything to Haunter, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Haunter. This power stops working while Haunter is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

name: Hitmonlee

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.

name: Hypno

attacks.name: Prophecy
attacks.text: Look at up to 3 cards from the top of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

name: Kabutops

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Kabutops equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Kabutops has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

flavorText: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

name: Lapras

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lapras but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: A Pokémon that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across water.

name: Magneton

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 100 damage to itself.

flavorText: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

name: Moltres

attacks.name: Wildfire
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Moltres when you use this attack. If you do, discard that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Dive Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

name: Muk

abilities.name: Toxic Gas
abilities.text: Ignore all Pokémon Powers other than Toxic Gases. This power stops working while Muk is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

name: Raichu

attacks.name: Gigashock
attacks.text: Choose 3 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and this attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If your opponent has fewer than 3 Benched Pokémon, do the damage to each of them.

flavorText: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Thunderstorm
attacks.text: For each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Then, Zapdos does 10 damage times the number of tails to itself.

flavorText: A legendary thunderbird Pokémon whose anger is said to cause storms. Some say it has lived above the clouds for thousands of years.

name: Aerodactyl

abilities.name: Prehistoric Power
abilities.text: No more Evolution cards can be played. This power stops working while Aerodactyl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

flavorText: A ferocious prehistoric Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

name: Articuno

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

abilities.text: If Ditto is your Active Pokémon, treat it as if it were the same card as the Defending Pokémon, including type, Hit Points, Weakness, and so on, except Ditto can't evolve, always has this Pokémon Power, and you may treat any Energy attached to Ditto as Energy of any type. attacks.text: Look at up to 3 cards from the top of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

name: Kabutops

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Kabutops equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Kabutops has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

flavorText: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

name: Lapras

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lapras but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: A Pokémon that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across water.

name: Magneton

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 100 damage to itself.

flavorText: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

name: Moltres

attacks.name: Wildfire
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Moltres when you use this attack. If you do, discard that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Dive Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

name: Muk

abilities.name: Toxic Gas
abilities.text: Ignore all Pokémon Powers other than Toxic Gases. This power stops working while Muk is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

name: Raichu

attacks.name: Gigashock
attacks.text: Choose 3 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and this attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If your opponent has fewer than 3 Benched Pokémon, do that damage to each of them.

flavorText: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.

name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Thunderstorm
attacks.text: For each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Then, Zapdos does 10 damage times the number of tails to itself.

flavorText: A legendary thunderbird Pokémon whose anger is said to cause storms. Some say it has lived above the clouds for thousands of years.

name: Arbok

attacks.name: Terror Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poison Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.

name: Cloyster

attacks.name: Clamp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.

name: Gastly

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Energy Conversion
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand. Gastly does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: A mysterious Pokémon. Some say it is a lifeform from another dimension, while other believe it is formed from smog.

name: Golbat

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Golbat equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Golbat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

flavorText: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

name: Golduck

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

flavorText: Often seen swimming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.

name: Golem

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Golem does 100 damage to itself.

flavorText: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.

name: Graveler

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Graveler (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

name: Kingler

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Kingler.

flavorText: The large pincer has 10,000 horsepower of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.

name: Magmar

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Found at the mouths of volcanoes and extremely hard to spot. There are very few instances of capturing this Pokémon.

name: Omastar

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omastar but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: A prehistoric Pokémon that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible for it to catch prey.

name: Sandslash

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

name: Seadra

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Seadra but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Seadra.

flavorText: Capable of swimming backward by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

name: Slowbro

abilities.name: Strange Behavior
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to Slowbro as long as you don't Knock Out Slowbro. This power can't be used if Slowbro is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: The Shellder that is latched onto Slowpoke's tail is said to feed on the host's left-over scraps.

name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

name: Weezing

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Weezing does 60 damage to itself.

flavorText: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, two Koffings can fuse into a Weezing over many years.

name: Ekans

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds such as Pidgey and Spearow whole.

name: Geodude

attacks.name: Stone Barrage
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

name: Grimer

attacks.name: Nasty Goo
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: All damage done by attacks to Grimer during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

name: Horsea

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

flavorText: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

name: Kabuto

abilities.name: Kabuto Armor
abilities.text: Whenever an attack (even your own) does damage to Kabuto (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does half the damage to Kabuto (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Kabuto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralzyed.

flavorText: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.

name: Krabby

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon named Krabby and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench if full.)

flavorText: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.

name: Omanyte

abilities.name: Clairvoyance
abilities.text: Your opponent plays with his or her hand face up. This power stops working while Omanyte is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omanyte but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

flavorText: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.

name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Headache
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play Trainer cards during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokémon will use psychokinetic powers.

name: Shellder

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hide in Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Shellder during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

name: Slowpoke

attacks.name: Spacing Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove a damage counter from Slowpoke. This attack can't be used if Slowpoke has no damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Scavenge
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Slowpoke in order to use this attack. Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

flavorText: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

name: Tentacool

abilities.name: Cowardice
abilities.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may return Tentacool to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to Tentacool.) This power can't be used the turn you put Tentacool into play or if Tentacool is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

flavorText: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

name: Zubat

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Zubat equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Zubat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

flavorText: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.

name: Mr. Fuji
rules: Choose a Pokémon on your Bench. Shuffle it and any cards attached to it into your deck.

name: Energy Search
rules: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Gambler
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Flip a coin. If heads, draw 8 cards. If tails, draw 1 card.

name: Recycle
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put a card in your discard pile on top of your deck.

name: Mysterious Fossil
rules: Play Mysterious Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Mysterious Fossil counts as a Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Mysterious Fossil has no attacks, can't retreat, and can't be Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. If Mysterious Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Mysterious Fossil from play.
